intro: Grewia barombiensis, commonly known as the Barombi gum tree, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. It produces small, round fruits that are typically red or orange when mature. Grewia barombiensis is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested or savanna-like habitats.
